main event: Two officers observed two unidentified flying objects over the Island of Terceira, Azores on 8 October 1954.
interesting points: The objects were circular in shape and bright orange in color., The objects glided at a steady speed of approximately 700 MPH., They were first observed at an estimated altitude of 3000 to 4000 feet., The sighting lasted for approximately 10 minutes., No sounds were heard during the observation.
witness description: officers from the 65th Air Division Maintenance Group
